intro: Euryops diosmiphyllus, commonly known as the golden bush, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its bright yellow, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with narrow, gray-green leaves. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it suitable for coastal and sandy environments. The flowers bloom in spring and summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
